adjective.description: Involving or relating to crimination; accusatory; incriminating.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in Abraham Fleming (c1552–1607), author, literary editor, and Church of England clergyman. From post-classical Latin criminatorius of or relating to accusation from classical Latin crīmināt-, past participial stem of crīminārī or crīmināre + -ōrius.
